expected regardless of right or wrong: i knew/thought/expected it to rain.
i didn't know/think/expect it to rain.
i thought/knew chulsoo is going.
i thought/knew chulsoo went.
kimchi not would like expected.
chulsoo american person is expected.
korean difficult would be didn't expect.
korean speak method/way know.
줄 for skill only in this form. 방법 way/method in general context.
i know how to ride a bike.
i don't know how to cook.
이라는 것을 알다. 것 for i knew the fact that.
어떻게 타는지 알아요. 줄 more convo. 는지 has many other uses.

줄 알았다: 가: 자야 씨, 왜 숙제 안 하셨어요? 나: 오늘 숙제가 있었어요? 저는 숙제가 있는 줄 몰랐어요. 숙제가 없는 줄 알았어요.
expected regardless of right or wrong: A: Jaya, why didn't you do your homework? B: Did we have homework for today? I didn't know we had homework. I thought we didn't have any.

expected regardless of right or wrong: I thought Andy came to school todayo. I didn't know he didn't come.

expected regardless of right or wrong: The wind was blowing so hard I thought it was cold. But now that I am outside, it's not cold.
